lines.content: David is a chatbot and task manager designed to help users stay organized effortlessly. Using David, users can add,
find, track, and manage different types of tasks, such as to-dos, deadlines, and events with ease. It features a simple
command-line interface and supports automatic task saving, ensuring that users never lose track of what needs to be
Adds a todo task to the task list.
Description: tasks without any date/time attached to it
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 6 tasks in the list.
Adds a deadline task to the task list.
Description: tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time
`SPECIFIC_DATE` should be in the format of year/month/day and `SPECIFIC_TIME` should be in `Hour:Minutes`
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 8 tasks in the list.
Adds an event to the task list.
Description: tasks that start at a specific date/time and ends at a specific date/time
`START` and `END` should follow the format of `Year/Month/Day` and/or `Hour:Minutes`
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 9 tasks in the list.
Shows a list of all tasks in the task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks a task as done in the task list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
## Marking Task as Not Done: unmark
Marks a task as not done in the task list.
Okay! I've marked this task as not done:
Delete a specified task from the task list.
There you go. I've removed this task for you:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Finds tasks which descriptions contain the given keyword. If task not found then, print out not found.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Data is saved automatically after any command that results in the data being changed.
If the program is closed unexpectedly or improperly, any unsaved changes will be lost, and the last saved version of the
task list will be used when the program is restarted.
All tasks are stored in a file named tasks.txt, located in the current directory.
Users can manually edit this file if needed, but modifications outside the program may lead to unexpected behavior.
* The main class of the David application, responsible for initializing

* Initializes the UI, storage, task list, and command parser.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.
* Runs the main event loop of the application, handling user input.
* The loop continues until the user enters the exit command.
* The main entry point of the program.

* The Parser class handles user input, processes commands, and executes appropriate actions
* on the task list, including adding, deleting, and marking tasks.
* @param storage Storage handler for saving and loading tasks.

System.out.println(System.lineSeparator() + "These tasks were found" + System.lineSeparator() + LINE_SEPERATOR);

* Parses and adds an Event task from the user input.
* @param task  The task list where the new task will be added.
* @throws DavidException If the description of the task is missing.
private static void parseEvent(String input, ArrayList<Task> task) throws DavidException {

task.add(new Event((input.substring(TaskList.getIndex(input, " ") + 1, TaskList.getIndex(input, "/") - 1)), input.substring(TaskList.getIndex(input, "from") + 5, TaskList.getIndex(input, "to") - 2), input.substring(TaskList.getIndex(input, "to") + 3), isDone));

* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param by          The deadline date for the task.
public Deadline(String description, String by, boolean isDone) {
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return A string showing the task's type, description, and deadline.
* Returns a file format string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return A string formatted for saving to a file, including the task type, completion status, description, and deadline.
* Constructs an Event task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the Event task.
* @param from        The start time of the event.
* @param to          The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to, boolean isDone) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* @return A string showing the task's type, description, start time, and end time.
return "[E]" + super.toString() + " " + description + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";
* Returns a file format string representation of the Event task.
* @return A string formatted for saving to a file, including the task type, completion status, description, start time, and end time.
* Constructs a Task with the given description, initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the Task.
* Returns the status icon of the task, marking it as done (X) or not done (space).
* @return A string "X" if the task is done, otherwise a space.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns the description of the task.
* @param status The new status of the task (true for done, false for not done).
* @return The new completion status of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task, showing its completion status.
* @return A string representation of the Task, including the status icon.
* Returns a file format string representation of the task.
* @return An empty string, to be overridden in subclasses.

* @return A string formatted for saving to a file, including the task type, completion status, and description.
